abstract: Joint investigation by United Nations and Organization for Prohibition of Chemical Weapons finds Syrian military dropped chlorine bombs on civilians at least twice in two years, and that Islamic State militants in Syria were behind poisonous sulfur mustard attack; both weapons are banned under international treaty.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: A United Nations investigation says that Syrian military helicopters had used the chemical on at least two occasions, and that ISIS had deployed sulfur mustard, which is poisonous.
snippet: A United Nations investigation says that Syrian military helicopters had used the chemical on at least two occasions, and that ISIS had deployed sulfur mustard, which is poisonous....

headline.main: Syria Used Chlorine in Bombs Against Civilians, Report Says
